titleStmt.title: M. Smith to James F. Robinson
CWG7925

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Dear Sir by law it is mad my duty as Town Clerk to send to you the name of the person receiving the highest No of votes for Police Judge below you will find the name in form you will confer a favor by Sending commission at your earliest convenience, with high regards I remain yours truly
I hereby certify that J C Hess recived the highest No -- of votes for Police Judge being (33 vots)

State of Kentucky
Mason County } Sct.
Sworn to before me a Justice of the peace for said county & state, this 7th day of April 1863
Charles Jos Fox -- J. P. M C

Dover
Police Judge
J. C. Hess
Com Isd Apr l0 1863
